Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
You recently downloaded our "2014 U.S. Retail Apps Report", which I hope you found informative. I thought you might also be interested in this blog about combating showrooming. Stay tuned for more great content from Pivotal Labs!
Imtiaz Jaffer Director of Marketing
Fighting Fire with Fire: How Retailers Can Use Mobile to Combat Showrooming <http://pivotallabs.com/fighting-fire-with-fire-how-brick-and-mortar-retailers-can-use-mobile-to-combat-showrooming/>
If there were ever any doubts about the prevalence of showrooming in retail, the last year has silenced the critics once and for all. With upwards of 57% of post-showrooming purchases being made at Amazon.com, it is not surprising that the web-only store has been named ‘Retailer of the Year’ by the National Retail Federation.
"Showrooming” - whereby a customer walks into a physical store, tries out a product, and then purchases that same product from an online retailer (usually at a cheaper price) - represents maximum value for the consumer, and maximum loss for a brick and mortar retailer.
So what can you do to combat showrooming? We recommend the following tactics:
- Offer in-aisle store comparisons - Entice people to buy on the spot - Offer superior customer service
Learn how you can take advantage of mobile to combat showrooming by reading the full post on our blog <http://pivotallabs.com/fighting-fire-with-fire-how-brick-and-mortar-retailers-can-use-mobile-to-combat-showrooming/>.
